dcterms:creator: Min Suk Chung
dcterms:description: The VKH dataset consists of sectioned anatomical images of a male cadaver, photographed using a Canon EOS 5D digital camera with 12 megapixels resolution. The images are stored as 5616×2300 color images, which were cropped to a size of 1024×1024 covering the entire head region. Manual segmentation was performed to label 8 regions including background, skull, teeth, cerebrum, cerebellum, nasal cavities, eyeballs, and lenses.
dcterms:title: Visible Korean Human (VKH) dataset

dcterms:description: VAA3D is a software tool used for bioimage visualization and analysis, which was utilized in the study to render 3D volumes from the VKH dataset.
dcterms:title: VAA3D
